Headline: People Digest: HQ Capital MD steps down; Endowus gets chief advisory officer
Text:
Photo: Internet Archive/ IllustrationBy Quynh NguyenJune 15, 2021Private equity firm HQ Capital managing director in Hong Kong Lucian Wu has stepped down from his role after a seven-year stint. In a separate development, Singapore-based wealth management platform Endowus has appointed banking veteran Wei Mei Tan as its chief advisory officer.Private equity firm HQ Capital managing director in Hong Kong Lucian Wu has stepped down from his role after a seven-year stint, AVCJ reported.HQ Capital is a part of the Germany-based HQ Group. Wu joined HQ Capital in 2014 with 32 years of experience in the finance sector, according to the investment firm’s website.In this role, he led HQ Capital PE’s secondary market activities in Asia. He has participated in secondary transactions representing over $500 million in total deal volume.Prior to HQ Capital, Wu had stints at Paul Capital, Henderson Private Capital, Jardine Fleming and Electra Partners Asia, according to Informaconnect.During that time, he successfully deployed and harvested capital across multiple market cycles, geographies, direct and secondary investment strategies.HQ Capital was formed in 2015 by combining independent alternative investment managers Auda, Real Estate Capital Partners and Equita. Through Auda and Real Estate Capital Partners, HQ Capital has been active in global private equity and in US real estate since 1989.Last year, HQ Capital held the final close of its eighth fund-of-funds, raising $750 million in committed capital. The Auda Capital VIII (ACAP VIII) surpassed its original target of $600 million, becoming HQ Capital’s largest global platform fund, the firm said in a statement.Singapore-based wealth management platform Endowus has appointed banking veteran Wei Mei Tan as its chief advisory officer.In this role, Tan, who brings with her over 20 years of financial market experience, will help drive strategic initiatives as well as build portfolio strategies and fund selections, according to a report by Tech In Asia.This appointment comes after the wealth management platform raised $17 million in a Series A funding round led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and SoftBank Ventures Asia in March.Before joining Endowus, Tan was in senior leadership roles at Credit Suisse and UBS Wealth Management. She also served as global co-head of advisory and investment solutions at Deutsche Bank.Founded in 2018, Endowus is led by Samuel Rhee, You Ning Sun and Gregory Van, former investment bankers and fund managers from Morgan Stanley Asset Management, Goldman Sachs, UBS and others.The firm bills itself as Singapore’s first and only Central Provident Fund (CPF) digital advisor, allowing users to invest their CPF and Supplementary Retirement Scheme (SRS) money, as well as cash.CPF and SRS are compulsory retirement savings schemes mandated by the Singapore Government for future retirement purposes for Singaporean citizens and permanent residents (PRs).endowus HQ Capital Private Equity
                                                ACAP VIII surpassed its original target of $600 million.

                                                OYO Hotels and Homes has appointed Alfian Lim as its new country head for Indonesia.
